loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 53-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 32 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he grows crops and vegetables to sell. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. His business is located in a rural area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy seeds, feed, fertilizers and other items to boost his farming business.  His business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy feed, seeds, fertilizers and other items to boost his farming business

loans.name: Artan

texts.en:
Artan is a 34-year-old married Egyptian Albanian and has two children.  Artan has been operating his pig farming business with the help of his father for the past four years in the rural area of a major city where he and his family reside. “I just love what I do. With the climate in our region being cool in the summer, pigs won’t need any access to a wallow. They have a limited tolerance to high temperatures and heat stress which can lead them to death. Thus, my friendly animal nature combined with the proper climate, have made it possible for me to have success with this activity. And of course, with my father’s help as well,” Artan said smiling.

He needs Kiva lenders’ help to build a stable for his pigs and he remains positive that they will help him financially.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a stable for the pigs

loans.name: Emerson Alexis

texts.es: Emerson es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Emerson trabaja en su propio taller electrónico en el que se dedica a reparar televisores, ventiladores, radios, control remotos para televisores y equipos de sonidos, entre otros aparatos, él ya cuenta con más de dos años de poseer ente negocio en el centro del departamento en que reside y cuenta con muchos clientes quienes lo prefieren por ser amable y honrado. Emerson solicita un credito por medio del cual pueda comprar diferentes repuestos como integrados, chips, cables, y otros más para reparar mayor cantidad de electrodomésticos y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Emerson is a very responsible and hardworking man who lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He works at his own electronics shop where he repairs televisions, fans, radios, remote controls, sound equipment and other items. He has had the business for more than two years in the center of the department where he lives and has many customers who favor him for his friendliness and honesty. Emerson is requesting the loan so he can purchase different parts like integrated circuits, chips, cables and other supplies to repair a larger amount of appliances and thus earn more income to provide his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase parts to fix appliances.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах на своем участке с В-Знаменка уже 18 лет. Основные культуры - помидоры, огурцы, редис. 

Шесть лет Владимир работал в Киеве крановщиком. В отпуске и на выходные приезжал и трудился на огороде у себя дома. Работы в Киеве не стало и Владимир решил занятся сельски  хозяйством - как основным источником дохода. Теперь Владимир уделяет больше времени детям и своим теплицам.

У Владимира много земли, поэтому он хочет построить еще одну теплицу осенью. Кредит понадобился для приобретения удобрений (3000 гривен), пленки (2500 гривен), семян (5000 гривен), мотоблок для вспашки (4500 грн)
texts.en:
Vladimir has been growing vegetables in greenhouses on his plot in Velikaya Znamenka for 18 years. His primary crops are tomatoes, cucumbers, and radishes. 

Vladimir worked in Kiev for six years as a crane operator. On vacations and days off he would go home and work in the garden. The job didn't last and Vladimir decided to farm full time. Now he has more time for his children and greenhouses. 

Vladimir has extra land, so he wants to build a new greenhouse in the fall. He needs a loan for fertilizer (3000 Hryvnia), plastic sheeting (2500 Hryvnia), seeds (5000 Hryvnia), and a rototiller for tillage (4500 Hryvnia).

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds, sheeting, and small machinery for his greenhouse.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталья занимается шитьем на заказ. Она уже пользовалась микрокредитами раньше и считает их очень удобными и полезными для бизнеса. Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 24000 гривен на закупку новых тканей перед выпускными балами. Она уже имеет несколько заказов и планирует купить необходимый материал благодаря кредиту. Она надеется увеличить свой доход и улучшить жилищные условия своей семьи.
texts.en: Natalya is a seamstress, who sews special orders. She has already used micro loans, and considers them very helpful for her business. She is asking for a loan of 24000 Hryvnia, to buy new fabric before the senior proms. She already has a few orders and plans to buy the necessary material using the loan. Se hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy material for sewing dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and cows to boost her dairy business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 46 years old. She lives in Kutaisi district, West Georgia with her 49 year old husband, 20 year old son and daughter in-law.  Nana requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nana’s husband is an artisan. He works on house renovations for private orders and earns a small monthly income. This is the only source of living for the family, which is rarely enough to cover their monthly expenses. 

Nana requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Nana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Nana will purchase calves. She wants to raise them and in the future sell them at a good price at the local markets. Nana’s new business will bring her a good profit. Part of the profit she will reinvest in the same field, in order to develop her farming and another part she will use for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Remmy

texts.en: Remmy is 28 years old. He is married and they have one child. He sells clothes and has been in the business for the past three years. He wants to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en: Mediatrice is 38 years old. She is married and has five children. With the loan, she will buy more utensils such as saucepans, flasks and cups to sell. She is planning to use the profits to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more utensils to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a married woman.  She has four children, all of whom attend school. Farida owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Farida has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in the business.
 
With the 45,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила замужем. У нее есть взрослые дети. Она имеет свой бизнес.

Людмила занимается тепличным хозяйством на протяжении 15 лет. Она выращивает ранние и поздние овощи.  Наиболее продаваемыми являются огурцы, помидоры и картофель. Людмила ответственная и трудолюбивая. Хочет развивать бизнес и увеличивать доход семьи.

Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на подготовку к сезону теплиц.  Ей нужно закупить удобрения, дрова, семена на вторую посадку и шланги для капельного полива.
texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has adult children. She runs her own business. 

Ludmila has been growing early and late season vegetables in greenhouses for the past 15 years. The most popular are cucumbers, tomatoes, and potatoes. She is a responsible and hard working person, and she wants to expand her business and improve her family's income. 

Ludmila is asking for a 15000 Hryvnia loan to prepare for the greenhouse season. She needs to buy fertilizer, firewood, seeds for a second planting, and hose for drip irrigation.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, firewood, seeds, and irrigation hose

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 57-year-old single woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 35 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail shop in which she sells water, drinks, sweets, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an urban area. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to to buy more drinks for stocking her retail shop. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to stock her retail shop.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, age 23, operates a motorcycle providing transportation services. He has been involved in this business for four years. He describes himself as a focused, visionary and determined man. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity within the area. David is not yet married.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES to supplement money he has saved in order to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own two more motorcycles within five years. He hopes someday to get married and have children, and he wants to be able to offer them a quality education.
 
This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 40 years old. She sells used clothes and has been in the business for fifteen years. With the loan, she wants to buy more used clothes and the profits from the business are expected to be used as a source of savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman but has no children. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Dorothy dreams of establishing a wholesale cereal shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 60,000 KES, she wants to purchase inventory of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Dorothee

texts.en: Dorothee is 32 years old. She owns a pub and she has been running the business for six years. She wants the loan to buy more beer and soft drinks. The profits from the businesses will be used for savings.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Zadith

texts.es:
Zadith de 54 años de edad, es divorciada y vive en compañía de sus 04 hijos  de 26, 25, 21 y 18 años de edad respectivamente, habitando cómodamente en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Zadith es el transporte de pasajeros para lo cual cuenta con un mototaxi que compró con sus ahorros hace 01 año, para realizar su trabajo  se levanta muy de temprano para dar en alquiler su mototaxi. También se dedica a la venta de carbón, este producto lo distribuye con la ayuda de su movilidad cada día. Le gusta su actividad ya que puede manejar sus tiempos libres, y comenta se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio y por los ingresos económicos ya que tenia muchas necesidades y gastos que no podía solventar, ahora se siente mas tranquila y cómoda ya que tiene un ingreso permanente y cuenta con más tiempo libre.Este será el préstamo número 02 con Kiva , por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. 
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, tiene planes de invertir en la compra de repuestos para mantener en buen estado su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Zadith is 54, divorced, and lives with her four children, ages 26, 25, 21 and 18. They live comfortably in their own home. 

Zadith's work is transporting passengers, for which she has a mototaxi that she bought with her savings a year ago. To carry on her work she gets up very early to rent out her mototaxi. She also sells charcoal and each day distributes this product with the help of her vehicle. 

She likes her work as she can manage her free time and comments that she decided on this type of work due to the need to have a livelihood and for the  income, as she had many needs and expenses that she could not cover. Now she feels comfortable and has peace of mind, as she has a permanent income and has more free time.

This will be her second loan with Kiva, and for this reason she hopes for your cooperation so that she can make her plans a reality. 

With the amount applied for of 2000 nuevos soles, she plans to purchase parts for maintaining her mototaxi in good condition.

loans.use: To buy parts for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
For the past years, Mercy has operated a detergent selling business with the help of the previous Kiva loans, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES she wants to purchase liters of detergents for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she's appreciative for the Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase liters of detergents to sell

loans.name: Kuzimat

texts.ru: Кузимат  живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города кишлаке. Он имеет большой пятнадцатилетний опыт в сфере животноводство. Когда начинал дело скотоводство, у него был один баран, за которым ухаживал. Как говорит сам Кузимат: «Я очень хорошо следил за своим единственным бараном. Десятки голов МРС и КРС  - тогда это было мечтой . Теперь это реальность, и мой доход и заработок на жизнь».  Со временем он становился мудрее и умелее в сфере скотоводства. Поначалу ему было нелегко, особенно в зимнее время, когда вся земля было покрыто снегом  и приходилось тратить больше средств на корм скота. Но годами опыт доказывал своё и Кузимат стал находить пути решения препятствий и способы для лучшего продвижения своего дела. На сегодня он имеет более 10 голов МРС и КРС. Его жена и трое детей также вовлечены в это дело. Его жена доит коров и подаёт молоко. Заработанные деньги от продаж молока, кефира и каймак тратят на ежедневные расходы семьи. В связи с сезонностью он не может продавать своих баранов и коров сейчас и купить корм, так как цены на них упали. Кузимат нуждается в дополнительных средствах для дальнейшего корма скота и приобретения новых скотов. С этой целью он обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. Считает, что приобретённый кредит сможет устранить его трудности и станет в его трудную минуту палочкой – выручалочкой. Выражает благодарность Арванд за содействие и огромную роль в его жизни.
texts.en: Kuzimat lives in a rural area far from the city.  He has 50 years of experience working with livestock.  When he started his business, he had one sheep that he looked after.  Kuzimat himself says, "I took very good care of my only sheep.  Dozens of heads of livestock were only a dream then.  Now it is a reality, it's my income and livelihood."  With time, he became more clever in the industry.  At the beginning, it was difficult for him, especially during the winter when the land was covered in snow and it cost him much to feed his animals.  But through the years, Kuzimat has proven himself and has come to find solutions to the obstacles he faces which help him move forward.  Today he has more than 10 head of cattle and 10 other animals.  His wife and three children are also involved in the business--his wife milks the cows.  The money earned from selling milk, yogurt and cottage cheese is used to pay for everyday expenses.  Because of the season, Kuzimat is unable to sell his sheep and cows, or buy feed since prices have fallen.  He needs additional funds for feed and to buy new animals.  With this goal, he turned to Arvand for a loan.  He believes the loan will allow him to eliminate his financial difficulties.  He is grateful to Arvand for the assistance and huge role it plays in his life.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Фирдавс молодой парень в возрасте 25 лет.   Он женат и  имеет  пока  одного ребенка. Фирдавс очень веселый и дружелюбный парень.  Он вместе со своей женой уже более два года занимаются откормом и купле продажей скота.   Этот вид деятельности дает им хороший доход.  В детстве к сожалению он не смог учится и получить образование так как в семье были финансовые трудности. Теперь ему приходится очень трудно и он не хочет чтобы его сын тоже имел такие трудности.  Фирдавс трудится не покладая рук чтобы дать сыну образование.  Это его основная задача на сегодняшний день.  Жена тоже помогает Фирдавсу всем чем может.  
  На данный момент Фирдавс планирует увеличить свое стадо, но у него  проблемы с финансами.  Он узнал у своих знакомых,что Арванд выдает кредиты и решил воспользоваться этим.  На полученный кредит Фирдавс хочет купить одного бычка  и расширить свой бизнес.  Очень надеется,что Арванд поможет ему при осуществлении его планов.
texts.en: Firdavs is a young man, 25 years old.  He's married and so far has one child.  Firdavs is a very cheerful and friendly guy.  Together with his wife, he has worked with livestock for the last two years, fattening and reselling cattle.  This has provided him with a good income.  In his childhood, he was unable to study and receive and education since his family was financially unable to provide this opportunity.  Now, he is experiencing difficulties as well, and he doesn't want his son to experience the same disadvantages.  Firdavs works tireless to be sure his son will have access to education.  This is his main concern at the moment.  His wife helps him any way she can.  Currently, Firdavs plans to increase his herd, but he's having financial problems.  His friends told him that Arvand provides loans and decided to take advantage of the opportunity.  With the loan, Firdavs wants to buy a bull and expand his business.  He very much hopes that Arvand will help him realize his goals.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Jader Isaac

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón una bella ciudad ubicada a 90 Km del departamento de León, donde existen diferente tipos de actividades comerciales.  

Jader Isaac se llama la Joven de 24 años de edad donde habita con su madre en este bello municipio, tiene buenos costumbre, sus principales sueños es vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia. 
 
Se dedica brindar servicio en uno de los centro de salud, hoy en día se dio cuenta que Ceprodel Y Kiva piensa en el desarrollo de las personas emprendedoras como es el caso de este joven Jader Isaac, de tal forma le está solicitando a que le brinden un financiamiento, para la compra de: madera y Zin Para mejorar el techo de su casa de habitación.

Esto sería de mucho beneficio después de llegar un día cansada de su trabajo a su vivienda seria de mucha importancia para mantenerse seguro de las fuertes lluvia que ocasionan daño a las viviendas. 

Hoy en día Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo con estos pequeños créditos que ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de vida y de la misma forma agradece al personal de Ceprodel que le ofreció este pequeño financiamiento.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a beautiful city located 90km away from León, in the department of León, where there are different types of commercial activity.

24-year-old Jader Isaac lives with his mother in this beautiful municipality with good customs. His main dream is to live in better conditions with his family.

He makes a living by offering services in one of the health centers. He has realized that CEPRODEL and Kiva think about the development of enterprising people such as young Jader Isaac. He is requesting financing from them so he can buy wood and corrugated iron in order to improve the roof of his home.

This would be of great benefit since when he comes home tired from work it would keep him safe from the strong rains that cause damage to homes. 

He is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL for their support through these small loans, which will help him to improve his living conditions, and he is grateful to the CEPRODEL staff who offered him this small loan.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated iron and wood

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla, es una joven de 24 años de edad, casada madre de 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, ella se dedica a vender cosméticos de manera ambulante anteriormente trabaja como obrera en una fábrica de textil pero quedo desempleada, pues es difícil la situación económica y no hay trabajo así la necesidad de ayudar a su familia la impulso a invertir lo poco que tenía para vender cosméticos. Actualmente tiene casi dos años de dedicarse a este negocio, sale a vender a salones de belleza, de casa en casa, ofrece en empresas y fábricas y personas en su vecindario. El crédito que está solicitando lo quiere utilizar para comprar perfumes, cremas, shampo, pinturas de labio, pinturas de baño, peines, productos de limpieza. Ella no solo desea vender cosméticos también desea agregar la venta de ropa y zapatos para conseguir más ingresos  y poder mejorar la calidad  de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Karla is a young woman of 24 years of age. She is married and has one six-year-old child. She lives in the city of Granada and makes a living by selling cosmetics on the streets. She was previously a worker in a textile factory but she was let go. The economic situation is difficult and there is no work so the necessity of helping her family drove her to invest the little she had into selling cosmetics. She has now spent two years in this business. She goes out to sell to beauty salons, businesses, and factories, and she also sells door-to-door and to people in her neighborhood. She wants to use the requested loan to buy perfume, creams, shampoo, lipsticks, bathtub paints, combs, and cleaning products. She does not want to sell only cosmetics; she also wants to add the sale of clothes and shoes to her business in order to obtain more revenue and to be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, creams, shampoo, lipsticks, bathtub paints, combs, and cleaning products

loans.name: Chicas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Yajaira es una joven integrante del grupo Chicas Trabajadoras, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica a las ventas, comenzó vendiendo ropa seminueva y ahora vende ropa y zapatos por catalogo; el crédito la ayudará a comprar zapatos y ropa de pedidos que ya tiene pendientes. Una gran meta para Yajaira es comprar un automóvil para hacer mas fácil la entrega de su mercancía y en un futuro pagarle una carrera a su hijo.
texts.en: Yajaira is a young member of the group Chicas Trabajadoras (Hard-working Girls). She is married and has a child. She makes a living from sales; she began by selling almost-new clothing and she now sells clothing and shoes by catalog. The loan will help her to buy shoes and clothing for pending orders. One of Yajaira's great goals is to buy a car in order to make delivering her merchandise easier, and in the future she wants to pay for her child to study towards a degree.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing for her catalog

loans.name: Noel

texts.es: El señor Noel de 66 años de edad, originario de Chichigalpa, casado, ambos jubilados, está solicitando nuevamente que se le brinde la oportunidad de su crédito, para seguir mejorando la vivienda, con el crédito anterior ha logrado cambiar el zinc del techo de los cuartos, ahora necesita cambiar el zinc del techo de la sala, así también aprovechar, para construir gradas de acceso, en la entrada de la vivienda. Don Noel se siente muy agradecido y a gusto con los inversionistas Kivas, ya que le han dado la oportunidad de apoyarles mediante créditos a las personas de escasos recursos económicos y obtener una mejor manera de vivir en el hogar.
texts.en: Noel is 66 years old, and is originally from Chichigalpla. He is married, he and his wife are both retired. He is requesting again to be given the opportunity to take out a loan, so that he can continue improving his home. With the previous loan he was able to change out the zinc roofing over the bedrooms. He now needs to replace the zinc roof over the living room. He will also build steps at the entry to the house. Noel feels very grateful and happy towards the Kiva lenders because they have provided opportunities and support through loans to people of scarce resources so they can achieve a better quality of living in their homes.

loans.use: to replace the zinc roofing over his living room and also to build steps in front of the house.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 23 years old. She has three children who are ages 5, 3 and 1. She and her husband are carpenters. Her husband earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Thu’s income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 3 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 8,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, Thu would like to borrow 8,288,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She always wants to raise her children up well and enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Srey Neang

texts.en:
Srey Neang is 21 years old. She is a cleaner controller who makes an income of $6 daily. She lives with her parents in Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. She is the oldest daughter in the family. She graduated from high school in 2010. 

Since she has an extensive family which has seven members, her parents cannot provide enough support for their children. Therefore, Srey Neang is requesting a loan of $1,250 to pay her tuition fees. This money will help her to pursue her studies in the university. 

In the future, she hopes to be employed by a private company in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Olivia works hard to support her family.
She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Olivia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.
Olivia has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is 45 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years.

Merla requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase fishing gear and supplies for boat maintenance, such as fishing net, paints, wood and bamboo. Merla would like to build and expand her business in the future, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase gear and supplies for fishing and for boat maintenance, like fishing net, paints, wood and bamboo

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living through a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Thelma has been in the motorcycle transport business for six years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 42, is married and has four children, three of whom are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn previously engaged in general store business but because of low income from it, it did not sustain some of their needs she left the general store to focus in farming rice.  This new business she has operated for one year, and now she has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her businesses.

Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 36 years old, married with six children. With five children currently in school, she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosana has a bakery in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her bakery business. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy flour, sugar, salt, and other ingredients. 

Rosana has been in this business for five years and earns additional income from a general store. Rosana would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, and other ingredients for her bread production business.

loans.name: Beta

texts.en:
Beta is 52 years old and has eight children.  Beta has three children who are in school.

Beta is engaged in buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines. Beta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional frozen products to sell.

Beta has been in the buy and sell frozen products for 2 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Beta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen products to sell

loans.name: Herriet's Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of three members; all are women. The Dansoman community is located in the greater Accra region. They have been making daily efforts to provide a better future for their children. The main economic activities of the partners are selling jewelry, eggs, flour, fish and foodstuffs.

Herriet was born in the community of Dansoman and lives in the same community where she was born. She is 45 years old, married to a 50-year-old and they have three children. Her main economic activity is selling fish, jewelry and eggs. She has a little shop at home where she operates her business. At this time, she is requesting a loan of GHS 1,000 to improve her business.

They need a total amount of GHS 1,850 to expand businesses

loans.use: To buy more fish, jewelry and eggs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly, de 35 años de edad  , esta casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en la casa de su madre.El negocio que tiene Kelly es la venta de golosinas en un tablero que instala en el frontis de su casa todos los días, se inicio hace tres años, logrando ganarse el aprecio y la preferencia de sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos.Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico adicional así como tambien le permite socializar con su vecinos, además comenta que le permite tener  una ocupación y sentirse productiva ya que cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien le da una mensualidad, pero prefiere mantenerse ocupada para distraerse, y así sentirse tranquila, teniendo planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir una tienda de comestibles.Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 01 con Kiva y agradece esta oportunidad brindada.Con el monto solicitado de 300 nuevos soles comprará golosinas al por mayor tales como galletas , chocolates , caramelos , entre otros para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Kelly, 35, is married, has two children, and lives in her mother's house.  She sells sweets from a counter she put up in front of the house, and has been in the business for three years now.  Her customers, who are mostly neighbors, appreciate and prefer her business.  Kelly enjoys her work because in addition to generating extra economic income it also allows her to socialize with her neighbors.  She also stays busy and feels productive, even though her husband gives her a monthly allowance.  

Her plans include expanding the business and opening a grocery store.  This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the opportunity.  The loan in the amount of 300 PEN will be used to buy wholesale sweets such as cookies, chocolates, candy, and other items to stock her business.

loans.use: To buy cookies, candy, chocolates and other items.

loans.name: Dios Es Nuestro Amor Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA MARTHA GIOCONDA CASADA CON HIJOS MAYOR DE EDAD, ABOGADA, NACIDA EN CHINANDEGA DESDE HACE 13 AÑOS EN EL BARRIO SAN AGUSTÍN, SU NEGOCIO ES VENDER COSMÉTICOS DE VARIAS LINEAS DESDE HACE 10 AÑOS,EL CRÉDITO QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO ES PARA AFILIARSE A NUEVA LINEA DE CRÉDITO PORQUE LE OFRECEN MAYOR PORCENTAJE DE GANANCIA EN LAS COMPRAS; SU VENTA DE COSMÉTICOS ES DIARIO PERO SUS RECUPERACIONES SON SEMANALES Y QUINCENALES.

LA SEÑORA MARTHA GIOCONDA SOLICITA UN CRÉDITO A CEPRODEL POR PRIMERA VEZ. PARA INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y OBTENER UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA PARA SU FAMILIA, TAMBIÉN PARA SATISFACER LAS NECESIDADES DE SUS CLIENTAS.

ELLA ES MIEMBRO DEL GRUPO "DIOS ES NUESTRO AMOR", QUE LO CONFORMAN MAYRA DEL SOCORRO, KARLA PATRICIA, KARLA VANESSA, TAMBIEN TIENEN SU PROPIO NEGOCIO, ESPERAN MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA CON ESTE CRÉDITO.
texts.en:
Martha Gioconda is married and has adult children.  She is a lawyer, born in Chinandega, and has lived for 13 years in the neighborhood of San Agustín.  For ten years she has been selling several lines of cosmetics.  The loan she is requesting is to sign up for a new line of products that offers her a greater profit margin.  Although she sells the cosmetics every day, she only collects payment on a weekly or biweekly basis.

This is Martha Gioconda's first loan through CEPRODEL.  With it she plans to increase sales by satisfying her customer's needs so she can give her family a better quality of life.

She is a member of the communal bank "DIOS ES NUESTRO AMOR", whose other members are Mayra del Socorro, Karla Patricia, and Karla Vanessa.  They also have their own businesses and hope for a better quality of life through this loan.

loans.use: To buy Stylus brand cosmetics.

loans.name: Efrain Antonio

texts.es: Efrain de 31 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra los  principales granos básicos como lo son, maíz y frijol cuando a pasado la cosecha se dedica a jornal en una finca que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia. Efrain desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y tambien mejorar su terreno que muestra la fotografia donde siembra. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: 31-year-old Efrain is a man who is very responsible with his household obligations, since he has always been known for giving the best to his children. He currently lives with his wife and his two children. He is very hard-working and he has always worked with joy and enthusiasm. He is a farmer and he plants the main staple crops: corn and beans. When the harvest is over he makes a living from working on a farm close to his place of residence for a daily wage. Efrain wishes to increase his sales. He is therefore requesting a loan which will allow him to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, and pesticide, among other things, and which will also allow him to improve his land (shown in the photograph). He wants this help since he has no other monetary income, and with it he will continue bringing daily bread to his home without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, etc., and to improve the land where he plants his crops

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Vilma del Carmen es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado a 90 km del departamento de León rodeado de montañas y ríos caudalosos que hacen del lugar un atractivo turístico. 

Es una señora de 53 años madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales solo una depende de ella, que esta en edad escolar.
Se desempeña como cajera desde hace ocho años actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante sola a sus hijos y llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Es una mujer admirable que ha jugado el papel del hombre de la casa como muchas en Nicaragua.
En los últimos meses se ha sentido mal de salud por lo que quiere realizarse exámenes médicos y comprar medicamentos por lo cual está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para mejorar su salud.

Pide el apoyo a los inversionistas de Kiva para que le financien este crédito ya que sabe que ellos ayudan al más pobre y necesitado que muchas veces no se pueden llevar a cabo objetivos por falta de dinero y solamente con los créditos se pueden resolver muchos problemas y cumplir sueños.
texts.en:
Vilma del Carmen is from the town of El Sauce, which is about 90 Kms from the department of León.  It is surrounded by mountains and wide rivers, making it an attractive tourist site.

She is 53 years old and has four children, only one of whom still depends on her and is in school.  For eight years she has worked as a cashier, allowing her to support her children and put food on the table every day.  She is an admirable woman who has taken on the role of head of household, like many women in Nicaragua.  Over the past few months she has not felt well and wants to undergo medical examinations and buy medicine.  That is why she is requesting a loan  through Ceprodel, to improve her health.

She is requesting support from Kiva lenders because she knows they help people in need who are unable to meet their goals because of a lack of resources.  Only with these loans are they able to take care of their problems and meet their goals.

loans.use: To pay for medical examinations and medicine.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina es una mujer de 29 años de edad joven, con mucha energía y con deseos de superarse y de salir adelante. Ella realizó hasta sexto grado de educación primaria y no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos que tenían sus padres en ese tiempo. Ella es casada y de su matrimonio ella tiene tres hijos dos de ellos los tiene en la escuela estudiando en diferentes grados de educación y una menor de edad. Fueron sus padres los que a muy temprana edad le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y hoy en día realiza esta actividad junto a su esposo especial mente el cultivo de café lo que es: limpieza, poda y fertilización. Ella se dedica a la agricultura en compañía de su esposo hace más de 10 años y el terreno donde tiene su plantación es propio el cual lo obtuvieron por herencia por parte de sus suegros y están a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en carro gracias a DIOS.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono y otros productos que evitaran que sus cultivos sean contaminados por plagas o por enfermedades como la roya.

Su sueño es que sus cultivos sean productivos cada año para poder así darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos y educarlos para que ellos tenga la oportunidad de estudiar y así alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida ya que sus cultivos de café son la fuente de trabajo e ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 29, is a young woman with a lot of energy and desire to get ahead.  She got as far as the sixth grade but was unable to continue her education because her parents could not afford it.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school and the youngest still at home.  From a very early age, Rosalina's parents taught her about agriculture; and now she grows coffee, alongside her husband, and handles mainly the cleaning, trimming and fertilizing of the crop.  For ten years she and her husband have been working on their own land which they inherited from her parents-in-law.  It is two kilometers from their house and they feel blessed by having a car to get there.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and other products to avoid plant disease and contamination.

Her goal is to insure her coffee crop is productive every year so she can give her children a good education and a better quality of life.  She wants them to have the opportunity to study and lead a better lifestyle.  Coffee production is the only means of income for the family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over twenty years, Bintiali has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 40,000 Bintiali wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 60 years old. She is married with four children. She sells ladies' clothes and has been in this business for 20 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more ladies clothes for sale. Josephine wants to renovate the house from the profits that will be obtained from the business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla operates a motorcycle spare parts business and repair from home. His potential customers are motorcycle operators. In addition he also operates a crop farming business which earns him another source of income. His major challenges are high cost of transportation to his place of operation.

With the KES 100,000 Abdalla wants to purchase a stock of motorcycle spare parts. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a 34-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be smart. Kennedy operates a carpentry shop where he makes furniture to sell. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a populated area. Kennedy describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds and timber. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy machines for the carpentry. Kennedy's business goal is to expand the business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy machines for the carpentry

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy lives in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a single businesswoman and owns a detergent business, hawking the products. The business has been operating for five years.
Mercy learnt about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve on her business operations. Her main challenge is inflation.
Mercy is applying a loan of 63,850 Kenya shillings to buy soap-making items and chemicals for making detergents. She will use the extra income to improve on her living standard. She hopes to own a factory where she could supply her products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy soap-making items and chemicals for making detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy powdered milk, sugar, cottonseed oil, etc

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in a rented house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Josephine operates a clothes-selling business; she sells in the market to people who live in her town and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one school-going child. She owns a grocery shop, a business which has been running for two years. In the business, she sells foodstuffs, household goods etc. She also runs a transport business, owning a motor cycle.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are inflation and bad debts. 

Caroline is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy a stock of groceries including maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her child. She aspires to open a mini-wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of groceries including maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of forage. 

Jane is married, and has eight children. Both Jane and her husband farm, and are currently growing bananas, maize, beans and sugar cane on their land. She likes beekeeping because bees are easy to keep and don't require management. 

This is Jane's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to buy food for her grandchildren and pay for their school fees. Her hope for the future is to be able to see her grandchildren through school.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a business selling Khangas (a cloth women wear and wrap around themselves). She sells from home and also from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she operates a business selling soft drinks. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en: Bernadette is single. She is 23 years old. She owns a bar and has been running it for four years. With the loan, she wants to add more beer to sell. She hopes to save the profits from the business.

loans.use: to buy more beer.

loans.name: Theopiste

texts.en: Theopiste is 19 years old and is married. She sells clothes and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more clothes for her business. The profits from the business will be reinvested.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives in the Likoni area of the Coast Province in Kenya. He owns a retail shop, a business that he has run for five years. In this business, he sells retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. He also runs a green grocery stall.

Jonathan learned about Milango through friends who invited him to join the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main business challenge is high inflation. 

Jonathan is applying for a loan of 83,450 KES to buy retail stock such as sugar, flour, etc. He will use the extra income from the loan to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy retail stock such as sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 29-year-old man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop since 2008 and with the proceeds he has been able to provide the basics for his family. Like all traders he faces challenges of price fluctuation and high taxes. His dreams are to educate his children and to begin trading in wholesale. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 60-year-old married man with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals mainly in cocoa farming and earns additional income from a retail shop. He chose to deal in cocoa after accessing the lucrative nature of the crop and the ready market due to the factory in town. A good father that he is he desires to educate his children up to the university level and expand his cocoa plantation. David intends to use the loan to pay workers who are pruning his cocoa garden.

loans.use: to prune his cocoa garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 35-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda with 2 children. He sells firewood in addition to repairing bicycles, having a retail shop and making bricks. He began the businesses 10 years ago with a hope of educating his children and raising money to construct rental houses which would guarantee him a sustainable income. John intends to use the loan to buy sugar, rice, soda, cassava, and other groceries to sell.

loans.use: to buy suger, rice, soda, cassava, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 50-year-old married man with ten children living in Kasese, Uganda. Moses began the business to educate his children and wants to earn money to pay school fees. He hopes to educate his children up to the university level and buy another taxi, despite challenges of high fuel costs and a poor road network which affect his profits. Moses intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy used the previous loan to buy cattle to sell. She is a 57-year-old hardworking lady who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children. She has been in the cattle-selling business for the last six years but also grows bananas. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock; however, she has a vision of expanding her business. Cissy intends to use the loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe BENKADI sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative du Mali.) 
Elles sont à leur 13ème  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles.
Mme SAFOURA fait le commerce des habits dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en première position de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des habits auprès des grossistes et revendra en détail sur place et au marché de Médine, à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Benkadi group are primarily married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 5 children. They mainly live in monogamous families in Médine, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is their 13th loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, requested in order to be able to satisfy their customers' needs.

Safoura is the group member who sells clothing. She is standing on the left of the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy clothing from the wholesalers which she will resell locally at the Médine market to a diverse and varied retail clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest and part of which will used to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Ankadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe ANKADI  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Sanoubougou II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 7ème  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme FATOUMATA fait le commerce de fruits dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche.
Elle compte acheter des chargements de mangues et d’oranges auprès des paysans producteurs. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché de Hamdallaye et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et des femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Ankadi group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 5 children. They mainly live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou II, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of Mali). This, their 7th loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, has been requested so that they can satisfy their customers' needs.

Fatoumata is the group member who sells fruit. She is standing second from the right in the picture. She plans to buy a large supply of mangoes and oranges from the farmers. She makes her sales, for cash or occasionally credit, at the Hamdallaye market and door-to-door to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest and part of which will used to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BALIMAYA  sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme AICHA fait le commerce de Fruits et Légumes dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt des paniers de concombres, de laitue, et de mangues auprès des grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes  en détail et au comptant  au marché de Hamdallaye et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Balimaya group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 5 children. They mainly live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is their 4th loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, requested in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

Aicha is the group member who sells fruit and vegetables. She is standing second from the right in the picture. She plans to use her loan buy some baskets of cucumbers, lettuce and mangoes from the local wholesalers. She makes her sales for cash at the Hamdallaye market and door-to-door to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 45 000 francs, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest and part of which will used to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a 38-year-old man who lives with his family in Sana`a, Yemen. He is the father of five children, all of whom are studying at a government school. 

Ameen has been running a water pump shop at the market. This shop is the only source of income for his family, but the income he makes is not enough to fulfill his family's needs. Ameen is a very hardworking, honest and responsible shopkeeper, father and husband. 

Presently he needs to purchase pipes to use for his business. Ameen has requested a loan of 199,999 YER from AMB. This will help him to increase his net income and savings. He wishes for the successful future of his children.

loans.use: to purchase pipes to use for his business.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 25 years old conservative lady, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead.
Fadwa's husband serves in the military on shifts. he also has a private business working in a small cafe. Fadwa wants to support her husband's business to enhance it and expand it, so she applied to this youth loan to bring more types of hot drinks to be served.

loans.use: to add more types of hot drinks to her husband's business

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man who has three children ranging in age from 21 to 32 years old. He describes himself as honest. 

Philip operates a metallic shop where he makes metallic doors, windows and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to to buy materials for making metallic doors and windows. His business goal is to open a hardware outlet within five years. 

This is Philip's second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials for making metallic doors and windows.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 25 years old. He is married with one child. He works as a motorcyclist and has been running a transportation business for four years. With the loan, Jean Damascene wants to buy another motorbike to use in his transportation business. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike to use in his transportation business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a business man living in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six children. Michael owns a retail shop which he set up through the income he obtained from the buying and selling of cattle.

His business has been in operation for over one year. Michael was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit for business growth. 

He is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenyan shillings to buy more retail stock like flour, tea leaves, etc. He is looking forward to setting up a transport business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more retail stock like flour, tea leaves, etc.

loans.name: Ngumbao

texts.en:
Ngumbao is a business man living in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. Ngumbao owns a retail shop which has been in operation for over one year. Ngumbao was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit for business growth.

He is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenyan shillings to buy more retail stock like flour, tea leaves, etc. He is looking forward to setting up another branch in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more retail stock like flour, tea leaves, etc.

loans.name: Nebert

texts.en: Nebert is an honest married man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in timber sales and brick making; he also rears cattle for milk production. Prolonged rains and inadequate capital pose a challenge to his business while his goals are building a residential house and expanding business to new areas. Nebert intends to use this loan to buy iron sheets and timber for completing his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and timber for completing his house.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a single mother of one child and runs a food cafe which has been in operation for six years. This is her only current source of income. 

Monica was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 31,500 KES to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, and other ingredients.

Despite the high level of price fluctuations, Monica believes she can save the extra income for the education of her child, provide a means of income to the other employees, and use part of the money to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, and other items for her cafe.

loans.name: Gnesouma Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe GNESOUMA  sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme FATOUMATA fait le commerce de fruits et légumes dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient debout au milieu.
Elle compte utiliser  son prêt pour acheter des paniers de bananes, d’avocat et de tomates fraîches qu’elle revendra en détail, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Hamdallaye à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 6 members of the Gnesouma group are principally married women with an average age of 37 and, on average, 5 children. They mainly live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is their 4th loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, which they have requested in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

Fatoumata is the group member who sells fruit and vegetables. She is standing in the middle of the picture. She plans to use her loan buy baskets of bananas, avocados and fresh tomatoes which she will resell for cash or credit at the Hamdallaye market, to a diverse and varied retail clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest and part of which will be used to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen.

He has been running a spice store to cover his family's expenses. The shop is making a good profit. 

He used his first loan and now Bashir needs to expand his business. He asked for a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy spices that he can offer for his business. This will attract  new customers to increase his profit. He thanks Kiva for financing him the first loan and hopes Kiva will finance this loan to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy spices that he can offer for his business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 49 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school. He is from Tulkarem.  Since 2010, he has owned a small farm.

Mohammad is requesting a loan from Ryada, which he will use to buy a tiling machine for his tractor. He hopes that this loan will help him till the soil better and faster, and thus increase his productivity and improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase a tiling machine for his tractor

loans.name: Faiza

texts.en:
Faiza is 44 years old, married, and has three children. They live in Hadramout, Yemen. She is a hard-working woman, who has completed secondary school. She has been selling clothes door-to-door, for many years. She started her business with a small amount of capital. Although the amount that she has gained is low, she exerts herself to provide resources for her family's daily expenses.

She would like to expand her business, but she doesn't have money. So, she applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy more clothes for resale. With this loan, her business will run well and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hayfa

texts.en:
Hayfa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son Mujahed appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Hayfa is a Palestinian mother from Attel near Tulkarm. She is the mother of seven sons and two daughters. Hayfa and her family suffer from bad economical conditions.
One of Hayfa's sons, Mujahed, needs to have surgery very quickly. Hayfa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Hayfa's son to enter the hospital and do the surgery.

loans.use: to pay the costs of her son's surgery

loans.name: Diane

texts.en: Diane is 23 years old. She is married with two children. She wants a loan to buy a motorbike, which will be used by her husband in his transportation business. The profits from the business will be applied toward their savings.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband to use in his transportation business.

loans.name: Aloysious

texts.en:
Aloysious is a thirty-three-year old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a farmer and has been in farming for a year.

Being the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university level while his business plans are to farm extensively and become a model farmer in the region.  Aloysious intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Mbasi

texts.en:
Mbasi is a resident of the Mariakani area, Kenya. He is a married father of one and runs a vehicle repair business that has been in operation for the last two years.

Due to lack of capital for business growth, he joined Milango to access more credit. He is therefore asking for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy motor vehicle bulbs for replacement during service. He looks forward to setting up a spare parts shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle bulbs for replacement during service.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a thirty-four-year old divorced woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She runs a salon and with the proceeds she has been able to buy land. Ever-changing customer preferences and inadequate capital affect her growth, while her business plan is to own a beauty parlor.

Florence intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell in her salon.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics

loans.name: Bademgnadjourou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  BADEMGNADJOUROU sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier Babemba un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 10ème  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme ROKIA fait le commerce  d’articles divers et de cosmétiques dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  des boucles d’oreilles,  des chaînes, des colliers et des chaussures pour femmes. Elles s’approvisionne auprès des grossiste et effectue ses ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Médine. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Bademgnadjourou group are married women with an average age of 37 and, on average, 4 children. They live in monogamous families in the Babemba district, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is their 10th loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, requested in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

Rokia is the group member who sells cosmetics and various other items. She is standing second from the left in the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy earrings, chains, necklaces and shoes for women. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers and makes her sales for cash or credit at the Médine market to a retail clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 27 500 francs, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest and part of which will be used to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy jewellery and shoes for women.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA  sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier Babemba un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles.
Mme KOROTOUMOU fait le commerce de grains de riz dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient debout au milieu.
Elle compte acheter, 3 sacs de 50 kg de riz auprès des paysans qu’elle revendra en détail à domicile et au marché de Médine, à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Dembagnouma group are married women with an average age of 39 and, on average, 4 children, who live in monogamous families in the Babemba district, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is their 3rd loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, requested in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

Korotoumou is the group member who sells rice. She is standing in the middle of the picture. She plans to buy 3 50-kilo bags of rice from the farmers, which she will resell door-to-door and at the Médine market to a diverse and varied retail clientèle. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 12 500 francs, part of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest and part of which will be used to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 30 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband works as a businessman. With the loan, Alphonsine wants to buy more salt, soap and cooking oil for sale in her store. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow, which will provide milk for the family.

loans.use: To buy more retail items such as soap, cooking oil and salt for sale.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
This loan will help Leonardo purchase inventory to expand his international delivery and phone service company.

When Leonardo moved to the U.S. from Colombia 15 years ago, he maintained many of his connections in Latin America. In 2010, Leonardo decided to buy his own franchise of Colombian Company Servientrega Internacional. By managing his own franchise, Servicarga Miami Lakes, Leonardo is able to bridge his local Miami community with his ties overseas. 

His store-front business was voted the best franchise in South Florida for the past two years and offers international delivery service, money transfers, phone service and phone accessory sales. Serving both individuals and corporations throughout the Miami area, Leonardo is now looking to expand his business. He needs a loan to purchase phone products and inventory in order to offer additional services to his clients. 

View Leonardo’s services at www.servicargamiami.com

loans.use: to purchase inventory to expand his international delivery service.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is an Andean artisan who specializes in Peruvian filigree jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of silver and gemstones for increased production.

Alfredo has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"I come from Catacao in northern Peru. It is considered the City of Filigree. I began to learn this art when I was 11 years old, with friends who taught me little by little. I enjoy it because a jeweler's work is a delicate art. I was awarded a scholarship to study with a professor from Israel and was offered the chance to teach filigree there. But I love Peru too much to leave."

"I would like to express my most heartfelt gratitude to you for taking part in this microcredit. I feel very proud to receive your support. I would like you to know that you'll always receive a quality jewelry piece from me that is lovingly crafted by hand. Many thanks!"

Use the link below to view Alfredo's silver filigree jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5201

loans.use: to purchase silver and gemstones for increased production.

loans.name: Sanouya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SANOUYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier Babemba un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles.
Mme MATOU fait le commerce de condiments à dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient debout au milieu.
Elle compte acheter, 100 kg d’oignons, 10 paquets de cube maggi auprès des grossistes qu’elle revendra en détail, au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché de Médine à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the SANOUYA group are married, 39 years old on average, and have an average of four children each.  They live for the most part in monogamous families in the Babemba district, one of the larger districts in the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.
They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with the hope of being able to meet the demand of their customers. 
Madame Matou is in the business of selling condiments in this group of women.  She is standing in the middle of the photograph.
She plans to buy 100 kg of onions and 10 packets of Maggi cubes from wholesalers, and then sell them at retail for cash and on credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. 
She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 15,500 FCFA, a part of which will be used to pay the loan and interest, with the rest going into her savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Rolando And Luis

texts.en:
Rolando and Luis are Peruvian artisans who specialize in the legendary style of Cuzco ceramics. They would like to increase their stock by investing in the purchase of clay and pigments in larger quantities.

Rolando and Luis have been selling through NOVICA since 2008. This is their story:

"Our parents taught us to appreciate the importance of Cuzco ceramic art from a very young age. We so wanted to help out that we would paint plates and offer them to our parents to sell, who instead treasured them. Our motivation comes from our admiration of Inca artistry and customs. Our compositions reveal the human aspect of this millenary culture. We describe this kind of work as art that breathes life into any setting."

"Thank you very much for this microcredit. Knowing that we can count on your support encourages us and inspires us to carry on. We will show you that we know how to make the most of this microcredit and we'll invest it wisely."

Use the link below to view Rolando and Luis' Cuzco ceramics on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6678

loans.use: to increase their stock by investing in the purchase of clay and pigments in larger quantities.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in hand-carved furniture and home decor items. He would like to invest in the purchase of prime materials such as wood, lacquer and chalk, and also to employ specialized artisans from his community.

Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

'I live my life amid wood. I'd describe my work as life itself, and my existence together with it. When I was only 17, I created my first piece and it was an immense satisfaction. Art guides my hands in that moment of pleasure as I begin a design. My pieces are inspired by the olden times and reflect the style of vintage pieces. They transmit my love for life and for nature — its flowers, birds and all the rich flora and fauna of our country."

"Please receive a great big hug and my most heartfelt thank you for your microcredit. I feel very happy to know that you trust me. As artisans we sometimes go through hard times, and it's amazing to know that there are people out there offering their support without even knowing you. May God bless you."

Use the link below to view Antonio's wood mirrors, jewelry boxes and home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5387
