loans.use: to invest in the purchase of prime materials such as wood, lacquer and chalk, and also to employ specialized artisans from his community.

loans.name: Godfred

texts.en:
Godfred is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in traditional African masks. He would like to invest in making improvements to his workshop.

Godfred has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"Due to financial constraints, my parents could not further my education and so I had to drop out of school and join my uncle, who was a wood carver. I have trained about 30 people to carve and some of them have now set up their own workshops. I currently have five people working with me. In addition, some university students have spent their vacations with me as interns. Thanks to the woodcarving, I've been able to educate my four children and I know that with constant sales, I'll be able to give them a brighter future than I had. This motivates me to wake up each day to carve!"

"I pray that you receive Allah's blessings to enable you to continue supporting people like us with your microcredits."

Use the link below to view Godfred's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7252

loans.use: to invest in making improvements to his workshop.

loans.name: Twizere Ii Group

texts.fr:
Concilie fait partie du groupe Twizere II et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a  38 ans et est mariée à Léonard, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant de 13 ans et qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce du haricot et du maïs depuis   4 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot et de maïs  à revendre pour  gagner plus. 

Le gain de son commerce lui permet de  bien nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Concilie is a member of the Twizere II group.  She lives in Gitega.  She is 38 years old and married to Leonard, a businessman.  Together they have one thirteen year old child who attends school. 

She has been in the business of selling beans and corn for four years. 

She is on her second loan with Turame.  With the KIVA loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large supply of beans and corn to sell in order to earn more.

The income she earns from her business will allow her to feed her family well.

loans.use: to increase her capital and to buy a large supply of beans and corn in order to earn more money.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a wood-carver from Ghana who specializes in African masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, aluminum plate, sandpaper, paints and brushes.

Frank has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"I have exhibited my work in the United States and in Germany. I used to assist a master carver at his workshop and I used to ask him so many questions! His answer was always the same: 'Just learn – this is a good skill to have.' I now have apprentices under my care. I think I have a sense of intuition with this art, and whenever it comes, I take advantage of it and put it to work.

"I thank the sponsors for their support and for this microcredit. I pray that they keep on with this initiative, which they are offering to some of us."

Use the link below to view Frank's wood sculptures and African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4790

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as wood, aluminum plate, sandpaper, paints and brushes.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 34 years old and single. She lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC last year to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. And now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Eustalia

texts.en:
Eustalia is 55 years old, widowed, and has three children. She lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. 

She produces copra (dried coconut meat used in oil production) to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC last year to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase copra materials.

loans.name: Brenda José

texts.es:
La joven Brenda José es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, desde muy pequeña habita en el municipio de El sauce donde conoció a su esposo y formó su hogar.

Debido a las circunstancias de la vida y la pobreza en que vivía su familia no pudo terminar su carrera universitaria pero soñaba con ser Administradora de Empresas. 

Hoy se dedica a laborar como secretaria donde lleva varios años ejerciendo esta actividad que le ha permitido ayudar a su familia sobre todo a su mamá que es alguien importante y sagrado en su vida.

En los últimos meses se ha estado sintiendo mal de salud y debido a la falta de dinero no ha podido realizarse unos exámenes médicos que le manda el doctor para detectar que enfermedad está afectando su salud.

Con la intensión de optar a un crédito se acercó a Ceprodel para tratar de resolver este problema y realizarse ultrasonidos y exámenes médicos.

Confía en Dios y en los inversionistas de Kiva que a través de Ceprodel le aprobarán su solicitud y podrá mejorar su salud para rendir mejor en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Brenda José is a mother of a school-age son. Since she was young she has lived in the municipality of El Sauce where she met her husband and she started a family. 

Due to life's circumstances and poverty in which her family lives, she couldn't finish her university studies but she dreamed about being a Business Administrator. Today she works as a secretary which she has been doing for several years and it has allowed her to help her family, above all her mother who is someone important and sacred in her life.

In recent months her health hasn't been good and due to the lack of money she hasn't been able to do medical examinations that the doctor sends her to in order to detect the illness that is affecting her health.

With the intensity of choosing a loan, she approached Ceprodel to try to solve this problem and to have ultrasounds and medical examinations. She trusts God and Kiva lenders that through Ceprodel her request will be approved and she will be able to improve her health to make headway in her job.

loans.use: to have ultrasounds and medical examinations.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is a Guatemalan artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in the purchase of fine silver and raw jade, as well as in motors for polishing his jewelry pieces.

Pablo has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"I dreamed of being an artisan since I was a little boy. My first piece of traditional silverwork was a Maya design bracelet with quetzal birds, crafted when I was 11. Today I dream of being able to leave my daughter an art that has been in our family for several generations.

"I would like to thank you for your support of traditional artisans. This microcredit will make it possible for me to purchase sufficient materials to keep us working. It means that four families will benefit from your microcredit, since we'll be able to craft more jewelry pieces to sell. I would also like to thank you for trusting in us through this great adventure."

Use the link below to view Pablo's handcrafted jade and sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7987

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fine silver and raw jade, as well as in motors for polishing his jewelry pieces.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a Ghanaian master carver who specializes in traditional and original African masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood as well as sandpaper, polish and wood stain for increased production.

Eric has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I learned carving from a shop for three years and later established myself with my own shop. I started carving for a full-time profession in the year 1997 at the age of 23 and now have one boy I work with. We are four children in the family, among which my junior brother and sister are also talented with the skill of carving. My brother helps me a lot at the shop.

"God bless the people who are helping me to have a good life by supporting me with this microcredit. I am very grateful to you all."

Use the link below to view Eric's African masks and wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1974

loans.use: to purchase wood as well as sandpaper, polish and wood stain for increased production

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She raises pigs for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over seven years and earns 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase feeds for the pigs. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is Mariam. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed ingredients for her food stall. She therefore generated more income that helped with her household's everyday expenses. She and her husband, who is a mason, are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for a new15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mariam hopes to sustain her business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and married with one child. She lives in Oroqieta City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She has been in GDMPC since the year 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 48 years old and widowed with 3 children. She lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns about 1,500 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2006, and now she has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Afqan

texts.en:
Afqan is 45 years old and married man. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). He has two sons and one daughter. Afqan's wife is a housekeeper. He has been raising cattle for the last 15 years. He says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals is a continuous effort. Afqan usually buys cattle, raises them, fattens them and sells them in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 80 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). This is the only source of financial income for the family. 

Afqan plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan due to its large use every day. Afqan is applying for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy more calves. He believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of his business. This is his fourth loan and he has a very good client history.

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
This is Myra, 39, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joselito, a farmer. At this time, Myra is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy vinegar, put it in smaller containers and then sell them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also has a piggery and an electronic loading station. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of vinegar to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan to buy feeds for her piggery.

Myra hopes to have more sources of income and dreams of having a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for vinegar needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 60 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish vending business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns about 5,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2012 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. Now she has requested a loan of 10,000PHP to purchase fishing materials. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
This is Esperanza. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Esperanza dreams to expand her business and hopes to always have good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosita dreams to have more jeepneys (transport vehicles) and hopes that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a daily basis. A fellowship group gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to upgrade her facilities and buy additional containers to expand her business.

loans.name: Therese's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis mai 2007.Il est composé de membres issus du même village et ont pour activité la plantation de bananes.

Celle qui est en position debout à l'extrême gauche sur la photo et levant le bras gauche,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 49 ans,elle est veuve et a 05 enfants.

Son activité consiste à faire du commerce de bananes.Elle a sa propre plantation qu'elle entretient et une fois la récolte arrivée,elle vend ses fruits.

Avec le prêt de caurie,elle compte investir 100000f dans sa plantation.

Son objectif est de contribuer aux charges familiales,augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created in May of 2007.  It is composed of members who come from the same village and who are all involved in working on banana plantations. 

The one standing on the extreme right of the photo with her left arm raised is the leader of the group.  She is 49 years old, widowed, and has five children.

She is in the business of selling bananas.  She has her own plantation which she manages, and after the harvest she sells the fruits. 

With the loan from CAURIE, she plans to invest 100,000 F in her plantation.

Her goal is to contribute to her family responsibilities and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to invest 100,000 F in her banana plantation.

loans.name: Mushfiq

texts.en:
Mushfiq is 41 years old. He is married with two children. Mushfiq supports his family while his wife takes care of their children. Mushfiq sells fruits and vegetables. He has been in this business since 1993, and has gained good experience in this field. His profits from this business is 120 AZN. Mushfiq  has one employee. He is well known in his area and has earned the respect of his neighborhood.
Mushfiq is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN  in order to renovate his shop. In the future, Mushfiq hopes to grow his business by opening a second shop to increase his revenues. By increasing his profits, Mushfiq will easily be able to educate his children and provide for all of their needs.
He has good loan history and this is his sixth loan.

loans.use: to renovate his fruit and vegetable shop.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 54 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents and looks after them because her parents are very old and ill. She has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 20 years. During these years she gained the necessary skills and knowledge for effective management of her business. She usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar.

Her profit from this business is 142 AZN monthly but it is not enough to take care of her parents. Now she needs funds to buy small calves and fatten them and then sell them. She also makes homemade yoghurt and sells it, together with fresh milk, to neighbors. This business is the only source of financial income for her family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes, like pilau and dolma.  

Now Jamila would like to buy more animals. For this purpose she applied for a loan of 2000 AZN. She will buy three calves and one milking cow. This will be her third loan with AqroInvest, and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy three calves and one milking cow

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq is a 55-year-old married man with three children.  He has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past six years. During these years, he gained the necessary skills and knowledge for effective management of his business. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. He also makes homemade yoghurt and sells it, together with fresh milk, to his neighbors. His monthly income is 144 AZN. This business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.

Now Rafiq would like to buy more animals. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. He will buy three calves and one milking cow. This will be his third loan with AqroInvest and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy three calves and one milking cow.

loans.name: María Lizett

texts.es:
Doña María Lizett es originaria del municipio de Achuapa, pueblo que se dedica en su mayoría al comercio para sobrevivir.

Es madre de dos hijas solamente una de ellas a su cargo en edad escolar, estudió la carrera de Magisterio y actualmente se desempeña como profesora donde imparte clases a niños de preescolar.

Con el propósito de tener mejores ingresos hace poco tiempo adquirió un molino para brindar el servicio a los pobladores de dicho municipio.

Se siente muy agradecida con Kiva y Ceprodel porque gracias a los préstamos que le han otorgado hoy tiene mejor nivel de vida porque sus ingresos han mejorado con su nuevo negocio.

Con el fin de brindar un nuevo servicio a sus clientes está solicitando un crédito para comprar un molino para moler carne, ya que quiere aprovechar la ventaja que en este poblado no hay este tipo de negocio.
Espera que Kiva le siga apoyando para seguir mejorando su nivel de vida tanto de ella como de su familia.
texts.en:
María Lizett is from the Achuapa municipality.  Her town devotes itself mostly to commerce in order to survive.

She has two daughters, and only one of them is school age.  María Lizett studied for a career in education.  She currently works as a pre-school teacher.

In order to get more income she got a mill a little while ago.  She did this to provide service to the residents of her municipality.

She is very grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel.  Thanks to the loans they have granted, she now has a better standard of living.  This is because her income from her new business has improved.

In order to provide a new service to her customers, she is requesting a loan to buy a meat grinder.  She wants to do this in order to take advantage of the fact that this type of business does not exist in her town.

She hopes that Kiva will continue supporting her so that she can continue improving her standard of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a meat grinder.

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Odbayar, 38 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband has been running an automobile tire repair shop, and during his spare time he renders taxi service to local people using his own automobile. 

Odbayar began to work as an operator at a private business entity five months ago. Before this job, she had worked in Korea for seven years on an employment contract between Mongolia and Korea. Her husband takes her to her work in his automobile, but over the years the automobile has deteriorated badly. 

Odbayar is requesting a loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase spare parts. Using these spare parts, her husband will repair his automobile and continue to render taxi service. Odbayar is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Net

texts.en: Net is 23 years old. He is a farmer’s son who lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Currently, he is a third year student who majors in computer engineering at the Institute of Technology in Cambodia. Due to the lack of funds support from his parents, Net is requesting a loan of $1,500 to pay his tuition fees. This money will help him complete his education and fulfill his dream. He expects to earn good money when he graduates with his bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
This is Virgie, 49, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Virgie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She gets her inventory at wholesale prices, and sells it by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Virgie dreams that her business will continue to grow, and hopes to have a vehicle.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and she can also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bayar

texts.en:
Bayar, 47, lives with his wife, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on rented land. During warmer periods of the year his wife makes interior decoration of house and do works at construction site on a contract basis with private businesses. His son previously worked as a security guard, and in 2010 he began to work as a service man at an auto repair garage. His daughter studies at university. 

Bayar trucks goods between districts. From 2005 to 2010 he bought and sold livestock hides and buffs (A soft, thick, undyed leather made chiefly from the skins of buffalo, elk, or oxen). He recently bought some land and wants to fence it. So he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT through Credit Mongol to buy wood planks. Using these planks he can fence his land as protection against outsiders as well as serve as a symbol of ownership. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood planks to fence his land.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is 49 years old and married with two children. His wife is a housekeeper. Islam has a door and window trading business in his city. He is very popular with his business because everybody knows him as a professional master. After making doors and windows, he sells them in the bazaar. His profit from this business is 120 AZN a month. He has 14 years of experience in this business. There are many wooden houses in his town. 

Besides this, people need wood to make houses warm. He also sells wood for this purpose. So, there is a big demand for his products. He has not enough funds for materials. Because of this, he needs a 2,000-AZN loan. He has a good loan history and this is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Battsetseg, 29 years old, lives with her daughter and parents in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. Using her previous loan, she installed low pressure furnace into house and made extension to the house. Her parents have retired from work and now gets state pension. She herself has been selling socks, tights, panties and other small garments by renting a counter at the trade center for three consecutive years. 

She is requesting a loan of 6700000 MNT to purchase an electric car. By purchasing the electric car, she can drive to work without paying for taxi service and increase work efficiency by coming early. More importantly, electric car releases almost no air pollutants at the place where it is operated. The capital city Ulaanbaatar has severe air pollution and if every citizen thinks same as Battsetseg does, the issue of air pollution will be solved quickly. The borrower is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is 54 years old, married and raising three children. She is very hardworking and has more than 10 years of experience buying and selling food products in a store. She handles her business alone since her husband is a worker, although her husband also helps. From this business her monthly profit is 120 AZN.
Raya sells groceries like rice, bread, sugar, eggs, milk, sausages, as well as other daily use products like deodorant, perfume, gel, soap and other accessories. She runs her business in her yard which is located at her house. 
Raya continues to improve her business, increasing the quantity of products and basic goods. On this occasion she asks for 2000 AZN to buy groceries like rice, oil, bread, sugar, eggs, milk, sausages and other things for sale in her store. She has a good loan history; this is her third loan.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like rice, oil, bread and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz is a 51-year-old, married man and father of two children. His wife stays at home and doesn’t work. Ten years ago he started his business, to improve his living and develop his financial situation. Now he sells fruit and vegetables, in a store. Eyvaz is well-known in the region, with his competitive prices and products. His profit monthly is 150 AZN. There is a big demand for fruits and vegetables in Azerbaijan. Because of that, he must expand his business.

Now, he needs a 2,000 AZN loan. Eyvaz is requesting a loan, so that he can invest in the purchase of more fruits and vegetables to sell at his business. He believes this investment will improve his level of sales and his family’s quality of life. This is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables, to resell at his business.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is 53 years-old and the married father of four children. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income for the family.  For 26 years he has grown fruits and vegetables in his yard and sold them in the bazaar. In this business his wife also helps him and from this business his monthly profit is 100 AZN.

In Azerbaijan, fruit is in very high demand and people like to eat fresh fruit a lot. Besides his fruit he also sells flowers. Elman is really optimistic about the future, regarding the expansion of his business, in order to raise the standard of living of his family.

For this, he has applied for a loan of 2000 AZN. Elman has already taken a loan from Aqroinvest before.  He is considered a good customer and this is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is 52 years old with three children and a wife. He is growing cattle in order to sell the meat in the central bazaar. He has been doing this business for 17 years together with his wife. Currently he is retired and has a monthly pension of 150 AZN per month. This is insufficient for taking care of his family’s financial needs, so that’s why he has dedicated himself to this business.

Jalal’s is selling his meet in the central bazaar to local butchers and the regular customers. Beef is in high demand in the region because it is used in everyday meals like kufta, bozbash, etc. Also during holidays people consume beef meat a lot, which helps him to earn more profits.

He has taken loan from Aqroinvest three times previously and has a good loan history. His fourth loan is 2,000 AZN and he plans to buy four calves with this money, to fatten them and then sell their meat. He is very optimistic about this loan, because of his familiarity with details of the business he is doing.

loans.use: to buy four calves to expand his business

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
This is Tomasa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more merchandise, thus generating more income. The loan also helped with her household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

Tomasa would like to apply for another 26,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Tomasa dreams of the continuous growth of her business and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
This is Amy, 51, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eddie, a carpenter, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Amy hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that all her children will have a job.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Khursheedan

texts.en:
Ms. Khursheedan is a 54-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family, and she is a very hardworking woman. She is the mother of 5 children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband's business. 

Her husband has been running a sheet metal shop since 2008. The loan will help her husband purchase metal sheets to sell. 

This shop is the only source of income for their family, so Khursheedan is hopeful that the loan will be helpful for the growth of business.

loans.use: To purchase metal sheets to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 47-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a carpenter by profession. 

Her husband has been running a furniture shop in the market since 2005. Presently he is interested in purchasing wood for making furniture. Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband purchase wood for making chairs, tables, racks, and beds. This will help him to increase his sales and income. 

He is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for his family. WIth the profit amount, Razia wants to construct a kitchen in her house. She wants to thank the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase wood for making furniture to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatou Alpha's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 15 Octobre 2012  à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles commencent à  comprendre le programme car étant au deuxième cycle. Des qualités comme  solidarité et l’esprit d’épargne commencent à émerger. Ces  femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata (en médaillon en haut et à  droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53ans, est  mariée et mère de huit enfants dont deux garçons. Elle est vendeuse d’huile de palme et de riz par détail. Qu’elle  achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires  pour la revente au village.

Ce nouveau lui permettra d’acheter deux sacs de riz à 15 000 F CFA l’unité, un carton de thé et bidon d’huile de palme de 20 litres à 15 000 CFA.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en: This lending group was established on 15 october 2012, inaugurated by their village bank. It is composed of women stemming from the same village, who are now on their second loan, and have learned new practices related to saving and solidarity. They are all involved in small commercial activities. Mrs Fatoumata (seen in a special image located on the top right of the photo) is the star lender in the group. She is 53 year old, married, a mother of eight children, including two boys. She is involved in the sale of palm oil and rice, that she purchases in the local markets and resells in her village to individual customers. This new loan will allow her to purchase two bags of rice for 15 000 FCFA, a box of teas, and a 20 liter container of palp oil for 15 000 FCFA. She plans to use the profits from these sales to support her husband in taking care of their children.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, a box of teas, and a 20 liter container of palm oil

loans.name: Sajida

texts.ru: Сачида живет в городе Душанбе в столице Таджикистана. Ей 51 год. Она замужем, и у нее трое детей. Ее сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сама Сачида занимается продажей женского нижнего белья и домашней одежды на центральном рынке города. Она уже 7 лет в сфере торговли. Сачида нуждается в кредите для оборота своего товара. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения ассортимента товара (женского нижнего белья, домашней одежды). В дальнейшем за счет прибыли она хочет приобрести еще одну торговую точку для продажи и расширить свой торговый бизнес.
texts.en:
Sajida lives in the city of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She is 51 years old. She is married and has three children. Her son is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Sajida works with selling women's underwear and home wear at a central town market. She has worked with sales for 7 years already. 

Sajida needs a loan for the purchase of her goods. She requests a loan to purchase an assortment of goods (women's underwear and home wear). Through the income from this loan, Sajida would like to purchase an additional point of sales and expand her sales business.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of goods (women's underwear and home wear)

loans.name: Gafur

texts.ru: Гафур трудолюбивый человек. Ему 48 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Его старший сын совершеннолетний, а другие не совершеннолетние. Гафур является единственным кормильцем семье. Более 20 лет он занимается услугой сварщика. Он предоставляет свои услуги местным жителям и таким образом зарабатывает деньги для проживания. Недавно он узнал, что его сын серьезно болен, и он должен срочно лечить его. Для него это беда стала причиной страдания и депрессии. Он обратился за займом в сумме 800 долларов США для покупки лекарства для лечения любимого сына. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gafur is a hardworking person. He is 48 years old. He is married with four children. His wife is a homemaker and is engaged with raising the children. His eldest son is an adult, but the others are still young. Gafur is the sole breadwinner for the family. For more than 20 years, he has been providing welding services. He provides his services to local residents and thus earns a living. 

He recently learned that his son is seriously ill and need immediate treatment. This trouble was the cause of suffering and depression for him. 

He applied for a loan of $800 for the purchase of medicines to treat his beloved son.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the treatment of his son

loans.name: Saifiddin

texts.ru: Сайфиддин очень ловкий, умелый и спокойный мужчина. Он мастер на все руки.  Сайфиддин  удивительный человек с  необычайно хорошими человеческими  качествами. Несмотря на свою хрупкость Сайфиддин имеет огромное сердце. Он хороший семьянин, у него любящая жена и трое детей. Его дети выросли чувствуя теплоту семейного очага и поддержку со стороны родителей. Сайфиддин всегда мечтал о такой семье и желает для своих детей доброго будущего. Как говорить сам Сайфиддин, «Я не воспользовался моментом, и упустил к сожалению шанс учиться и получить высшее образование. Но, несмотря на это, изучил несколько профессий, и они выручают меня сегодня». И в правду, Сайфиддин хороший сантехник и зарабатывает этим делом себе на жизнь. Ведь услуги сантехника востребованы всегда. Вот уже пятнадцать лет Сайфиддин своей деятельностью кормит семью, выдал дочку замуж…Теперь планирует сыграть свадьбу сына.  Пока ищут  подходящую невесту, решил сделать дома ремонт. Планирует привезти  будущую невестку в новый, чистый дом.   Но для этого ему не хватило немного денег. И чтобы закончить быстрее ремонт, Сайфиддин решил взять  кредит.  И в этом ему на помощь пришёл МДО «Арванд».  На полученный кредит Сайфидин хочет купит строительные материалы.   Он надеется, что сможет войти в доверие организации и получить нужную сумму. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Saifiddin is a clever, skillful and calm man.  He is a master of all trades.  He is an amazing person with unusually good humane qualities.  Despite his fragility, he has a huge heart.  He's a good family man, and he has a loving wife and three children.  His children grew up feeling the warmth of hearth and support from their parents.  Saifiddin always dreamed of such a family and wants a good future for his children.  He says, "I didn't take advantage of the moment and unfortunately missed the chance to study and receive a higher education.  However, I have learned several trades and they help me today."  

Truthfully, Saifiddin is a good plumber and makes his living supporting his family with this work.  After all, a plumber's services are always needed.  He has provided for his family this way for 15 years, married off his daughter, and now plans to hold a wedding for his son.  While they search for a suitable bride, he has decided to renovate his home.  He plans to bring his new daughter-in-law into a new, clean home.  However, he doesn't quite have enough money saved.  In order to more quickly finish the repairs, Saifiddin decided to take out a loan.  Arvand is offering help in this capacity.  With this loan, Saifiddin wants to buy construction materials.  He hopes that he will be able to gain the trust of the organization and receive the needed sum.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Choisuren

texts.en: Choisuren, 39 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Before living in a ger, his family lived in a rental apartment and when they purchased land in 2012 they moved out of the rental apartment. He is a professional welder who has been working at a private business entity for many years. His wife has been doing construction interior decoration. His daughter goes to high school. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase clothes in large volume from China. After purchasing the clothes from China, he wants to sell the purchased clothes in Russia at a higher price. This business will certainly generate more income for his family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares about his daughter's education greatly.

loans.use: to purchase clothes from China

loans.name: Harlan Francisco

texts.es:
El joven Harlan Francisco es un Sauceño de corazón, se graduó como Biólogo y actualmente se desempeña como responsable de servicios municipales para una Institución estatal. 

Uno de sus grandes sueños es llegar a tener un negocio de comidería ya que le apasiona complacer el paladar de las personas y realizar platos exquisitos.

En este momento su gran proyecto es estudiar un curso universitario de cocina para luego iniciar el negocio y conquistar a sus posibles clientes por la calidad de la comida.

Por este motivo está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para poder estudiar este curso, ya que son costosos y con su salario no puede cubrirlo.

Solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva que le apoyen con su solicitud para poder llevar a cabo su objetivo y en un futuro cumplir su gran sueño, además que es un proyecto que le puede servir de mucho cuando aún no tenga trabajo.
texts.en:
Harlan Francisco is a Sauceño (native of El Sauce) at heart. He graduated as a Biologist and at the moment he is in charge of municipal services for a state institution.  One of his biggest dreams is to have a restaurant since he is passionate about pleasing people's palates and making exquisite dishes.

Now his big project is to take a cooking course at university to later start his business and win over potential customers with the quality of food. For this reason he is requesting a loan with Ceprodel to be able to study this course, since it is expensive and with his wages he can't cover it.

He is asking Kiva lenders to support him with his request to be able to carry out his goals and in the future to fulfill his big dream. In addition, it's a project that can help him a lot even when he doesn't have work.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking course at university.

loans.name: Myriam Esther

texts.es:
Myriam Esther es una joven soltera que se ha dedicado toda su vida a cuidar a su mamá quien es alguien importante en su vida. 

Habita en el municipio de El Sauce y se siente muy orgullosa de haber nacido y crecido en este pueblo que a pesar de estar alejado del bullicio de la ciudad está lleno de una paz y cultura que muchos pueblos carecen de ello.

Desde muy joven inició a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su hogar y mantener a su madre, se desempeña como secretaria y gracias a este trabajo se está preparando profesionalmente para en un futuro tener mejor nivel social.

Solicitó un crédito en Ceprodel con el propósito de mejorar la salud de su madre con el cual comprará medicamentos y para pagar consultas médicas.

Recurrió a esta financiera porque sabe que los inversionistas de Kiva financian a las personas sobre todo de escasos recursos para resolver problemas de salud el cual es su caso.
Espera del apoyo de estas personas para mejorar la salud de su madre, ya que es una gran ayuda que muchas veces no se pueden resolver con el salario.
texts.en:
Myriam Esther is a single young woman who has devoted her whole life to caring for her mother, someone important in her life.  She lives in the town of El Sauce and is very proud of having been born and raised in this town that, despite being far away from the hubbub of the city, is full of a peacefulness and culture that many towns lack.

She started working at a very young age to support her household and her mother.  She works as a secretary, thanks to which she's preparing herself professionally to have a better social status in the future.

She requested a loan from CEPRODEL with the goal of improving her mother's health.  She'll buy medicine and pay for medical consultations.

She turned to this financer because she knows that Kiva lenders finance people, especially those with few resources, so they can resolve health problems, which is her situation.  She hopes for the support of these people to improve her mother's health, because it's a big help that often can't be resolved with a salary.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to pay for medical consultations

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
This is Perlita, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and they have children. They are managing their household as they operate the business. At this time, Perlita is working hard to provide income for their family.

She operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students who need her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes, like office documentation or writing a resume, as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Perlita hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 59, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Mario, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They both work hard to provide a good future for their whole family.

Helen operates a manufacturing business. She makes hair clips which customers find attractive because of the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are teenagers from her local community. She also retails rice. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials needed for making hair clips, like cloth, clips, glue and other items needed.
 
Helen hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and to provide a good future for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials needed in making hair clips.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 59, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Erlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a direct selling business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Erlinda hopes that her business will continue to grow and also that no one in her family will get sick.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband and three chidren. Her husband owns a shop selling bags in the main market. This shop is the only source of income for the family. Her husband's income is insufficient to fulfill the needs of the family. Education expenses of the children are increasing day by day, so Naseem and her husband want to increase sales at his business in order to increase his income. 

Ms. Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of bags to sell in her husband's shop. Naseem is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one. She is thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of bags to sell.

loans.name: Azalshoh

texts.ru: Азалшох 45 летний женатый мужчина и отец пятерых детей. Он со своей семьей живет в столице Таджикистана, а точнее в городе Душанбе. Его жена работает, а дети учатся в школе. У Азалшох среднее образование. Он занимается предоставлением услуги такси уже 2,5 года. Азалшох развозит пассажиров по маршрутной линии своего города. Азалшох обратился за помощью в организацию для получения кредита. Он запрашивает кредит для ремонта автомашины с целью улучшения процесса своей работы.
texts.en:
Azalshoh is a 45-year old married man, and the father of five children. He lives in the capital of Tajikistan together with his family, e.g. in the city of Dushanbe. His wife works, and the children go to school. Azalshoh has secondary education. He has worked as a taxi driver for 2.5 years already. 

Azalshoh carries passengers on a route in his town. Azalshoh turned for help from our organization in order to receive a loan. He requests a loan for the repair of his car with an aim to improve his work processes.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca. She previously accessed a PHP 50,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan in the amount of PHP 38,000 to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Francisca dreams to have another stall and hopes that her children will have a good life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sirojidin

texts.ru: Сирочидин житель города Вахдат, расположенный в 20 км к юго-востоку от столицы. Ему 40 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. У Сирочидина высшее образование. Он работал по своей специальности бухгалтером. Его жена занимается растениеводством. При дворе дома у них имеется земельный участок, где она выращивает овощи и зелень. В данное время Сирочидин не работает. Он хочет приобрести легковую автомашину и заняться предоставлением услуги такси. У него имеется опыт вождения. Сирочидин планирует развозить пассажиров по маршрутной линии Вахдат-Душанбе, и в день он намерен делать пять рейсов. С этим намерением он обратился в Хумо за кредитом для приобретения автомашины.
texts.en:
Sirojidin is a resident of Vahdat, located 20 km south-east of the capital. He is 40 years old. He is married and the father of three children.  Sirojidin has university education. He worked as an accountant in the past. His wife is involved in agriculture. In the yard of their house they have land, where she grows vegetables and herbs. 

At this time, Sirojidin does not work. He wants to buy a car and start a taxi service business. He has driving experience. Sirojidin plans to drive passengers from his town to the capital, and plans to make five round trips a day.  Sirojidin requested a loan from Humo to purchase a car to start a taxi service business

loans.use: to purchase a car to start a taxi service business

loans.name: Faxraddin

texts.en:
Faxraddin is 54 years old, married, and has 2 children, an 18-year-old and a 20-year-old son. 

Faxraddin has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. His sons are studying. 

Faxraddin wants his his sons to go into business. He started his taxi-driving business seven years ago. Now he needs a 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy spare parts because his car has broken down. 

He is thankful to Komak Credit Union and Kiva for supporting him. He wants to use the money from his business to help his family and to change his car. In the future, Faxraddin wants to buy a new car because this car is old and uncomfortable for passengers. This will make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda. She previously accessed a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan in the amount of PHP 40,000 to buy more merchandise items and products, to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosalinda dreams of a continuous expansion of her business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Ms. Samina is a 46-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a general store in the market near his house. This store is the only source of income for his family. Presently her husband wants to purchase a variety of products for the store that include wheat, sugar, flour, rice, beans, etc. to sell. However, due to lack of money he finds it difficult.

For that reason, his wife Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase the needed goods. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's shop. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 42-year-old, hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three daughters. Her husband has been driving a taxi for 20 years and this is the only source of income for her family. 

Right now, there is a lot of repairing and tuning work required in the engine of the taxi because it’s almost impossible for her husband to get some earnings from it. Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to repair the engine of her husband's taxi, so he can drive it properly. With the profit amount, her husband would buy one more taxi in the future. 

Rukhsana desires to provide quality education to her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Jemi

texts.en:
Jemi is a 34-year-old man and is married to Welly, a 33-year-old lady. They are blessed with four children, namely: Donny, 13, studying at the 1st grade of Junior High School; Donna, 9, 3rd grade of Elementary School; Dino, 5, and Dicky, 1 month old. 

Jemi owns a welding business. He has been engaged in this business for years. From the business he is able to generate money for his family's daily needs. Jemi was thinking to improve his business by adding more spare parts and to purchase raw materials. He was seeking for capital assistance to do so.

Jemi requested a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000. He has planned to spend the loan on a welding machine, oil, ferrous materials, etc.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts and  raw materials

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is a 34-year old hardworking single woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh foods and also has a banana plantation. With the proceeds from her businesses she has been able to pay rent and buy land, despite challenges of perishability and lack of adequate capital. Her dream is to buy land for extensive farming and to venture into modern farming methods. Joselyne intends to use the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 50-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a welder by profession. He has been running a welding shop in the area. This shop is the only source of income for the family. 

Nargis has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase iron rods, solder rods, welding rods, and welding machines for her husband's shop since the stock of the shop is almost finished. She is hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for the business and for her family. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase welding machines and a variety of welding rods for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson has four children. He lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. He is a farmer, which he has been doing for 10 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. What Benson enjoys most about farming is dairy keeping. His biggest challenge is drought.

Benson is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo because it works with farmers and teaches clients how to keep records. His highest monthly expense is school fees. 

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Benson owns the following: cow, bicycle. He does not own pig, poultry, pump, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cow

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito del  Agustino. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “Manos Unidas” una de ellas es la Sra. giovanna   de 31 años de edad madre soltera y con  2 hijos, la Sra. giovanna se dedica ya hace 6  años a la venta de ropa de niños  en un pequeño puesto todos los días,  la Sra. giovanna  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos y  de su casa,  En el futuro le gustaría tener una butik propio donde poder vender su ropa de niños y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en una pequeña butik   y así poder tener más ingresos.la sra. giovanna es la tercera de la mano izquierda con polo negro, A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y   diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
This group consists of responsible women who engage in different business activities. All of them reside in the District of Agustino and are members of the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas” (Joined Hands).

One of the members is Sra. Giovanna. She is a 31-year-old single mother with two children. For the past six years, Sra. Giovanna has been selling children’s clothes every day from a small vending stall. She says that she has gained the loyalty of her customers and is able to generate income to cover her children’s expenses and those related to her home. In the future, she would like to have her own boutique where she can sell children’s clothes and obtain more income.

With this loan that was issued to her, Giovanna will invest in a small boutique so that she can earn more income. Sra. Giovanna is the third woman on the left (from the group’s perspective) wearing a black shirt. On a parting note, she would like to give Kiva a hug and tell everyone that she plans to accomplish all of her goals.

loans.use: to invest in a small boutique.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Ms. Riffat is 37-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. From the past 19 years her husband has been running a paint shop in the market. He is the only income-earner in the family and this shop is the only source of income for his family. His monthly net income is inadequate to meet the household needs so he is planning to grow his business by purchasing more products for the shop. This will help him to increase his monthly net income and savings. However, due to the lack of finance he finds it difficult.

Ms. Riffat wants to help her husband to cover the cost of purchasing paint in different colours and a variety of paint brushes. Therefore she has requested a loan amount of 25,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase paint and paint brushes to sell.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms. Sughran is 44 years old and a housewife. She is a mother of four children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He is a rickshaw driver by trade. Presently his rickshaw is not working properly due to which he is unable to generate any amount of income. Therefore he wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to financial constraints, he can't afford the cost of repairing.

Ms. Sughran has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Paksitan to help her husband continue his work. Sughran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this great contribution.

loans.use: To repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 58, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Montano, a farmer, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating a business. They are working hand-in-hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) of jeepney, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Helen hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

Note: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn money and modified the jeep into a 20-seat jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly Filipino.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Tubumuco Group

texts.fr:
Saidi  fait partie du groupe Tubumuco et  habite à Ngozi. Il a 52 ans et est marié à Amida, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  8 enfants, âgés de  7 à 27 ans, tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  la boutique (riz, savon, sel, sucre…) depuis  3 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de savons, une grande quantité de sel et de sucre,…à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter un véhicule de transport et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Saidi is a part of the Tubumuco group and lives in Ngozi. He is 52 years old and is married to Amida, a shopkeeper. Together they have eight children, aged from 7 to 27 years old; all go to school. 

Saidi has been a selling rice, soap, salt, sugar, etc. for three years in a shop. He is on his second loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a lot of soap and a large quantity of salt and sugar [that he will] resell and earn more. 

In the years to come, he would like to buy a vehicle and see his children [continue to] go to school.

loans.use: to buy a lot of soap, salt, and sugar

loans.name: Rosa Martina

texts.es: Rosa tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene 8 hijos, vive en el municipio de San Juan Pueblo, junto a sus hijos, nietos y esposo. En su casa tiene establecido su propio negocio desde hace 10 años donde vende variedad de cosméticos como desodorantes, champú, cremas, maquillaje etc. Rosa ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener el negocio, actualmente solicita el noveno préstamo que es por 12,000 Lempiras, para comprar lociones, maquillajes, crema, champú y desodorantes para mantener productos y vender. Su meta es mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives with her husband, children, and grandchildren in the town of San Juan Pueblo.

Rosa established her own business at her house 10 years ago. She sells a variety of cosmetics such as deodorants, shampoo, crèmes, makeup, and other items. Rosa has requested several loans in order to maintain her business. She is currently asking for her ninth loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL so that she can buy lotions, makeup, crèmes, shampoo, and deodorants in order to maintain an inventory of products to sell. Her goal is to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy lotions, makeup, crèmes, shampoo, and deodorants.

loans.name: Lisseth María

texts.es:
Lisseth María es una joven de 29 años, casada, madre de cuatro hijos tres de ellos en edad escolar que bajo sus posibilidades ha tratado de dar lo mejor en cuanto a educación y sustento alimenticio.

Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a laborar como profesora de primaria en una comarca ubicada a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce.

 A pesar de lo incómodo del camino para llegar a la escuela ejerce su profesión con esmero y entusiasmo.

Todos los días sale de su casa a las 5 de la mañana en bicicleta hasta cierta parte luego tiene que caminar a pie para llegar a su destino y estar puntual en la escuela, ya que el camino es incómodo y no hay acceso más que a pie.

Con la intensión de obtener un crédito se presentó a Ceprodel ya que sabe que hay unos inversionistas del extranjero llamados Kiva que financian créditos para mejorar el nivel de las personas de escasos recursos.

 Este lo solicita para comprar una lavadora con el fin de ahorrar tiempo y trabajo, ya que su familia es numerosa y le toca una labor de hogar pesada.

Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Lisseth María is 29, married, and the mother of four children. Three of her children are in school, and she has tried to provide them with a good education and nutritional food. For over 10 years, she has been an elementary school teacher in a district located 10 km from the city of El Sauce. Though getting to school is inconvenient, she is an enthusiastic and thoughtful teacher. She leaves her house at 5 a.m., riding her bicycle and then walking because part of the road is only accessible on foot, to reach the school on time.

She has applied to Ceprodel for a loan because she knows that Kiva lenders provide loans to low-income people. She is seeking the loan to buy a washing machine so that she can save time and work. She has a large family, and the household chores are significant. She hopes and trusts in God that these people will support her application so that she can invest.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 32-year-old, married woman, with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She is a teacher and, with her meager salary, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Poor working conditions and low salary are her major challenges while her dream is to build a permanent house for residence and to buy land for farming. 

Mary intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and blessed with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town-dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Edubejes

texts.en:
Edubejes is 50 years old, married, and has five adult children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. She raises hogs, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. She also makes snack foods. She sells Buchi, a rice cake made from sweet rice flour that is molded into shape with a sweet bean paste filling and sesame seed coating and deep fried under high heat before serving. 

Edubejes is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, and sugar for her food selling business. In the future, Edubejes would like to expand her  business to support her family and also to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Rubina Group

texts.en:
Rubina is 38 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband has been running a snooker club for 12 years. The club is located in the central market of the city and has been running very successfully. 

Due to the increase in customers, her husband wants to purchase one more snooker table.
